Class ec.e.hab.BasedDesignator 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class ec.e.hab.BasedDesignator 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.e.hab.BasedDesignator
public class BasedDesignator
extends Object
Class to hold on to a designator and manipulate it generically, regardless of whether it is direct or indirect.

BasedDesignator(Designator)
Construct a BasedDesignator given a (presumably direct) Designator.
BasedDesignator(Designator, DirectDesignator)
Construct a BasedDesignator given a (presumably indirect) Designator and an accompanying DirectDesignator to base it's path on.

childName()
Return the last element in the pathname of the path we are holding onto (and we had better be holding onto one).
delete(Haberdashery)
Remove our designated object from a Haberdashery.
determine(Haberdashery)
Procure a (direct) BasedDesignator for the object which we currently designate.
get(Haberdashery)
Retrieve our designated object from a Haberdashery.
getBase()
Return the base we are based on.
getDesignator()
Return the Designator we hold onto.
isDirect()
Test if our Designator is direct.
isRooted()
Test if we are based at the root.
parent()
Generate a BasedDesignator for our hierarchy parent.
rebase(DirectDesignator)
Construct a new BasedDesignator like us but with a different base.
toString()
Produce a tidy string representation of ourselves.

BasedDesignator 
  public BasedDesignator(Designator des)
Construct a BasedDesignator given a (presumably direct) Designator.
Parameters:
des - A (direct) Designator to hold onto
BasedDesignator 
  public BasedDesignator(Designator des,
                         DirectDesignator baseDes)
Construct a BasedDesignator given a (presumably indirect) Designator and an accompanying DirectDesignator to base it's path on.
Parameters:
des - An (indirect) Designator to hold onto.
baseDes - A DirectDesignator of a Unit to base the path in 'des' on

get 
  public HaberdasheryObject get(Haberdashery hab)
Retrieve our designated object from a Haberdashery.
Parameters:
hab - A Haberdashery to get the object out of
Returns:
An instance of our designated object.
determine 
  public BasedDesignator determine(Haberdashery hab)
Procure a (direct) BasedDesignator for the object which we currently designate.
Parameters:
hab - A Haberdashery to get the object from.
Returns:
A determined BasedDesignator for the object.
delete 
  public void delete(Haberdashery hab)
Remove our designated object from a Haberdashery.
Parameters:
hab - A Haberdashery to remove the object from.
getDesignator 
  public Designator getDesignator()
Return the Designator we hold onto.
getBase 
  public DirectDesignator getBase()
Return the base we are based on.
rebase 
  public BasedDesignator rebase(DirectDesignator newBaseDes)
Construct a new BasedDesignator like us but with a different base.
Parameters:
newBaseDes - The DirectDesignator of a different root.
parent 
  public BasedDesignator parent()
Generate a BasedDesignator for our hierarchy parent. This only works if we are holding onto an IndirectDesignator!
childName 
  public String childName()
Return the last element in the pathname of the path we are holding onto (and we had better be holding onto one).
isDirect 
  public boolean isDirect()
Test if our Designator is direct.
Returns:
true if direct, false if indirect.
isRooted 
  public boolean isRooted()
Test if we are based at the root.
Returns:
true if root based, false if not.
toString 
  public String toString()
Produce a tidy string representation of ourselves.
Overrides:
toString in class Object
